question: Find the (0, 1) entry of $\mathbf{A} \times \mathbf{B}$, where \begin{align*} A  = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \newline 3 & 4 \end{bmatrix} && B= \begin{bmatrix} 0 & 1 \newline 2 & 3 \end{bmatrix}\end{align*}

answers.feedback: Correct.
Incorrect. Entry $i,j$ of the product matrix is computed as the dot product of row $i$ of the first matrix and column $j$ of the second matrix.

question:
Find the (2, 1) entry of $\mathbf{C} 	imes \mathbf{D}$, where  egin{align*} C  =  egin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & -1 
ewline 2 & 3 & 4 
ewline 0 & -1 & 2 \end{bmatrix} && D=  egin{bmatrix} 2 & 1 
ewline 0 & 1 
ewline -1 & 2 \end{bmatrix}\end{align*}

answers.feedback: Correct.
Incorrect. Note that these questions use zero-based indexing.
Incorrect. Entry $i,j$ of the product matrix is computed as the dot product of row $i$ of the first matrix and column $j$ of the second matrix.
